botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Scented-leaved pelargoniums are evergreen shrubs or perennials with strongly aromatic foliage and small, single flowers in shades of pink, purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: As with all pelargonium cultivation, this cultivar with perform best in good light. A houseplant or conservatory plant that can be used outside in pots or as bedding when conditions are frost-free
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cutting in spring or summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back in spring if plant is getting leggy. Deadhead regularly
how_to_grow.pests: Generally trouble-free, but may suffer from aphids in spring
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble free, but can suffer from grey moulds, pelargonium rust and Pelargonium virus
